thread.title: Most web surfers do it on their phone
thread.title_full: Most web surfers do it on their phone

title: Most web surfers do it on their phone
text:
Most web surfers do it on their phone September 2 2015 at 09:40am 

The average Briton now spends one in six of their waking hours online. 
Surfing the web took up an average of two hours and 51 minutes of our time each day in the first six months of the year, a study of 73,000 people found. And more than half of that time (55 per cent) was spent on mobile devices rather than computers. 
Britons used their smartphones to surf the web for one hour and nine minutes a day, and used tablet devices for 26 minutes, according the research by the Internet Advertising Bureau and the UK Online Measurement Company. 
Our top priority is checking up on friends and family on social media websites such as Facebook. We now devote nearly half an hour a day to social media – around a sixth of the time we spend online, up from an eighth two years ago. 
Britons also spent around 6 percent of their time online playing computer games, up from 3 percent. 
The survey only measured ‘active’ internet usage and did not take account periods where someone had a web browser open but was working on something else. – Daily Mail Related Stories
